meanings.definition: Serving or intended to prohibit something
meanings.sent1: The prohibitive sign warned people not to enter the construction zone.
meanings.sent2: The prohibitive rules were put in place to prevent cheating.
meanings.sent3: The prohibitive fence around the garden kept the mischievous rabbits out.
meanings.sent4: Her prohibitive glare silenced the noisy room in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The prohibitive lock on the door kept the valuables safe from intruders.

meanings.definition: So high or burdensome as to discourage purchase or use
meanings.sent1: The prohibitive cost of the luxury car made it unaffordable for most people.
meanings.sent2: The prohibitive price of the concert tickets deterred many fans from attending.
meanings.sent3: The prohibitive amount of homework made the students groan in despair.
meanings.sent4: The prohibitive mountain stood tall, challenging even the most experienced climbers.
meanings.sent5: The prohibitive distance to the nearest store made walking there a daunting task.
